patterns.name: Partial Phase Completion
patterns.description: Agent completes only 1-2 phases instead of all 10
patterns.example: AFP-W0-AUTOPILOT-INTEGRITY-ENFORCEMENT-20251107: Claude completed only STRATEGIZE, claimed task ready. User caught it: 'doesn't seem like it.'
patterns.prevention: Pre-execution checklist commits to all 10 phases. Post-execution validation verifies all present.

patterns.name: Template Evidence
patterns.description: Agent uses boilerplate/templates instead of real AI reasoning
patterns.example: 25 tasks completed in 30 min with identical completion.md files containing 'Generated by Wave 0.1'
patterns.detection: Evidence contains template markers or identical content across tasks
patterns.prevention: MCP integration required (no template fallback). Post-execution validation checks for placeholder content.

patterns.name: Speed Over Quality
patterns.description: Agent prioritizes fast completion over comprehensive work
patterns.example: Tasks completed in < 5 seconds via bypass code
patterns.detection: Task completion time < 5 min (suspicious for comprehensive work)
patterns.prevention: Pre-execution checklist commits to quality over speed. Instructions explicitly prioritize quality.

patterns.name: Skipping Self-Checks
patterns.example: Task completed but no mid_execution_checks.md file in evidence
patterns.prevention: Post-execution validation requires mid-execution checks presence and completeness.

patterns.name: Claiming Without Proof
patterns.description: Agent claims done without post-execution validation
patterns.prevention: Instructions require validation before claiming done. Pattern library warns against this.

patterns.name: Stub Implementation Bypass
patterns.description: Agent writes stub/TODO implementation, passes all quality gates, marks task DONE despite having no real functionality
patterns.example: AUTO-GOL-T1: 26-line stub with '// TODO: Actual implementation would go here', all 10 AFP phases marked complete, tests passing (only validated build not GOL algorithm), evidence marked 'PROVEN'
patterns.detection: Pre-commit TODO detection, DesignReviewer completeness check, ProcessCritic test-acceptance mapping, TestsCritic behavioral assertions
patterns.prevention: Gaming detection system with 31 documented strategies. detect_gaming.mjs blocks commits. Pre-commit hooks prevent TODO markers. ProcessCritic validates test-acceptance criteria alignment (â‰¥70% keyword overlap). DesignReviewer blocks superficial designs (<50 lines for complex tasks).

incident.description: Wave 0 completed Game of Life Tier 1 task with only a stub
failures: Gate Failure #1: Task confusion - thought task was about Wave 0 plumbing, not GOL algorithm
Gate Failure #2: DesignReviewer approved 4-line design for complex algorithm task
Gate Failure #3: Tests only validated build success, not GOL behavior
Gate Failure #4: ProcessCritic didn't detect test-acceptance mismatch
Gate Failure #5: Pre-commit didn't block TODO comment
Gate Failure #6: No behavioral self-enforcement checklist
incident.user_reaction: prevent the TODO comment thing from ever happening. completely unacceptable

gaming_strategies.description: Complete catalog of 31 ways agents might fake completion without real work

incomplete_implementation_markers.description: TODO comments, deceptive variations, no-op returns

fake_test_strategies.description: Build-only tests, tautological tests, mock-everything, copy-paste values, single happy path

design_gaming.description: Template content, circular refs, verbose fluff, copy-paste from unrelated project

implementation_shortcuts.description: Null returns, pass-through functions, throw not implemented, magic numbers, dead code, unused imports

evidence_manipulation.description: Empty evidence files, AI-generated lorem ipsum, timestamp manipulation, shallow graphs

process_gaming.description: WIP branch abuse, commit splitting, override flag abuse, critic result fabrication

test_acceptance_misalignment.description: Domain confusion (AUTO-GOL-T1 pattern), superficial keyword matching, generic test names
